Name.label: Autosomal dominant disease associated with focal palmoplantar keratoderma as a major feature
Malformation syndrome with odontal and/or periodontal component

TextSection.Contents: Hypotrichosis-osteolysis-periodontitis-palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome is an extremely rare ectodermal dysplasia syndrome characterized by hypotrichosis universalis with mild to severe scarring alopecia, acro-osteolysis, onychogryphosis, thin and tapered fingertips, periodontitis and caries leading to premature teeth loss, linear or reticular palmoplantar keratoderma and erythematous, scaling, psoriasis-like skin lesions on arms and legs. Lingua plicata and ventricular tachycardia have also been observed.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
